review_title: Information, events, magazine : focus on land conservation
reviewer_affiliation: Former Temporary Employee, less than 1 year
pros: Co-workers shared parks, flowers, camping trips, etc. Team environment. IT department is well versed in the company mission and is ready to assist employees. Work/life balance was noticeably positive. Vice Presidents were open to all staff, not just a select few department people, so easy to talk to about work related activity. Near Metro stop, plenty of reasonably priced restaurants. Building had ice cream socials etc.
cons: Metro in the evening commute was tiring to be part of a large crowd waiting for the next train, when none were arriving, but many trains on the opposite track.

review_title: Great organization and a wonderful place to work!
pros: Supportive workplace culture and a dedicated staff doing important work for the land trust community. Love working here!
cons: As is often typical in the conservation field, staff and board diversity is something that the organization has been working to improve. We've got a long way to go as a community, but the Alliance is working hard to address this across the organization.

pros: The job was great and the boss and colleagues were great. I learned many new things about land conservation and the environment.

review_title: We do a lot for a mid-sized nonprofit
pros: Staff are hard-working, passionate and dedicated to excellence. Strong support for teleworkers, family leave and overall schedule flexibility. Excellent benefits.
cons: Staff experience varies widely depending on who your supervisor is--most are very good, some are okay and a few are not good (from what I hear). Financially conservative when it comes to hiring and adding staff capacity, which is good for long-term stability but the trade-off is that ambitions often outstrip capacity.
